intro: Rhynchotechum parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered rhynchotechum, is a member of the Roridulaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are clustered in small inflorescences. Rhynchotechum parviflorum is often found in regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in dry, open habitats.
